channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: High Noon is recalling some vodka seltzers mislabeled as Celsius energy drinks
item.description: Some beach variety packs of High Noon hard seltzers included canned cocktails mislabeled as blue raspberry Celsius energy drinks. The affected lots we...

item.title: What will rescission do to foreign aid? Details are murky. Here's what we found out
item.description: Congress approved the clawing back of $7.9 billion in foreign aid pledges. Who ends up losing out?

item.title: The Fed holds interest rates steady. And, Texas releases bid for new redistricting map

item.title: Father James Martin has taken heat for his LGBTQ acceptance

item.title: What Trump's threat to tariff Russia's trade partners means for India
item.description: President Trump said India would pay the price for buying Russian oil and military equipment. Here is a look at how India, with one of Asia's largest ...

item.title: High Noon recall warns some Celsius energy drink cans may contain vodka seltzer
item.description: Beverage brand High Noon is recalling some of its beach variety packs due to some cans being mislabeled as non-alcoholic Celsius energy drinks.

item.title: Arkansas teacher charged with killing couple who were hiking in Devil’s Den with their kids
More than 30 killed in nursing home hit by Beijing floods
item.description: Local officials admit "loopholes in emergency planning" and say the incident is a painful lesson that serves as "a wake-up call".

item.title: Swedish jihadist jailed for life over IS murder of Jordanian pilot in Syria
item.description: The killing of Lt Moaz al-Kasasbeh by the Islamic State group was shown in a grim video circulated online in 2015.

item.title: Watch: Huge stick insect discovered in Australia
item.description: A new "supersized" species of stick insect that is roughly as heavy as a golf ball has been discovered in Australia.

item.title: 'Like a sci-fi movie': US baby born from 30-year-old frozen embryo breaks record
item.description: It is believed to be longest that an embryo has been frozen before resulting in a successful live birth.

item.title: Russian strikes kill eight and hit Kyiv apartment block, officials say
item.description: A boy and his mother are among the dead and Kyiv says it has seen the biggest number of child casualties of the war.

item.title: Brown University strikes agreement with Trump administration to restore lost federal funding
